head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden ¶ 1. Nov. 1862 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of a sum of fourty pounds Sterling (£40) from the vote of publications ...

div.p: X62/7375, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the transfer of a sum of fourty pounds Sterling (£40) from the vote of publications on Australian plants to that of travelling and incidental expenses, and I beg further to solicit, that the remaining amount of the vote of publishing indigenous plants, being the sum of twenty pounds sterling (£20) may be placed at my disposal.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary.
Approval for M's request was minuted on this letter.
